Jays GM: 'False reports' preceded Farrell deal

"It probably didn't go as smoothly as we think it could have. That's just reality. There was a lot of gamesmanship," Blue Jays general manager Alex Anthopolous said of the John Farrell deal. (Globe, 3:41 p.m.)

Content from Twitter

Few hold sway in Electoral College

The presidential outcome may depend on what happens in the 106 counties that Republican George W. Bush won in 2004 and that voted for President Obama in 2008, according to an Associated Press analysis. (AP, 1:21 p.m.)

Deficit, green jobs
divide an Iowa town

A wind-energy tax credit has proved to be a point of contention between President Obama and Mitt Romney as they compete for the votes of Iowans.
Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

Win over Jets comes with questions

The Patriots are masking their problems with the scent of victory, instead of cleaning them up.

Plans raise worries for school

Some fear the educational opportunities and diversity of the Josiah Quincy Elementary School are at risk under the school-assignment proposals.
Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

Red Sox take good first step

With John Farrell, the Red Sox have an adult in the corner office, someone who “knows how we do things around here,’’ to use a painful expression.

Do you need a knee replacement?

“Decision aids” help patients weigh the pros and cons of knee replacement surgery, which is costly, painful, and occasionally leads to negative outcomes.
Opinion | Adrian Walker

Whose life is it, anyway?

Jim Carberry, whose wife decided to end her life last year near the end of a terminal bout with cancer, argues fervently that this should be a human right.

Church welcomes the fabulous

On Sunday, the First Church Somerville held its second annual drag gospel worship service, followed by brunch and a full drag show.

impact your brain

Politics

George McGovern dies at 90

George S. McGovern, the three-term US senator from South Dakota who suffered at the hands of Richard Nixon one of the worst electoral defeats in US history, died Sunday. (Globe)
